modelCorrections.rawOutput:
Here's the corrected HTML based on the WCAG 2.1 violation description and the example provided:

*Extracted text from website*: "Demetri Andriani HOME STORY TOUR"
- Incorrect HTML: <html xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml">
- Corrected HTML: <html lang="en" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml">

Explanation:
The <html> element is missing the lang attribute, which specifies the language of the document. Adding the lang attribute with the appropriate language code (e.g., "en" for English) helps assistive technologies, such as screen readers, to correctly pronounce and interpret the content. This improves accessibility for users who rely on these technologies.
